alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 02 at 5:59AM MST until March 04 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FRIDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH EARLY EVENING ACROSS THE WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, SANDIA/MANZANO AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN PLAINS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Winds will become strong and humidities will plummet on Friday as the jet stream moves overhead and a potent surface trough develops in the lee of the lee of the central mountain chain. High temperatures will also climb around 10 to 20 degrees above normal, while Haines Indices vary mostly from 4 to 6. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday morning through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast Highlands, Sandia/Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, and Eastern Plains below significant snowpack Friday from late morning through early evening. The most critical conditions will occur during mid to late afternoon, when winds will be the strongest. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 9 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
